wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the cv-builder project. Explain its purpose as a full-stack job application productivity tool built with Laravel 12 and Filament 4. Describe the core functionality including CV management, job application tracking, AI-powered CV review using OpenAI, PDF snapshot generation, and performance metrics. Document the high-level architecture, key user workflows, and value proposition for developers and job seekers. Include an overview of the admin interface powered by Filament, highlighting dashboard widgets and resource management. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'CVVersions', 'JobApplications', and 'PDFSnapshots'. Provide practical examples of common use cases like creating a CV, running an AI review, and tracking application status. Address the relationship between major components and how they integrate to deliver end-to-end functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on the complete job application lifecycle. Explain the creation, editing, and state transitions of job applications through the JobApplication model. Detail the core attributes including company_name, job_title, application_status, send_status, application_deadline, next_action_date, and job_description. Describe the two-dimensional status system that separates application_status (hiring funnel progression) from send_status (submission state). Document the form layout in JobApplicationForm.php with its logical sections and field validations. Explain how the application_deadline and next_action_date fields enable proactive job search management. Include practical examples of common workflows such as creating a draft application, preparing materials, and finalizing submission. Address the relationship between application status values and user actions, including how status transitions reflect real-world hiring processes. Provide guidance on best practices for maintaining accurate application records.

wiki_catalogs.name: CV Creation and Editing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for CV creation and editing functionality. Explain the workflow from initiating a new CV through the CreateCv page to saving and viewing it. Detail the form structure defined in CvForm.php, including field groupings, validation rules, and dynamic UI components. Describe the role of EditCv.php in modifying existing CVs and how it integrates with the sidebar UI component in cv-edit-with-sidebar.blade.php for enhanced user experience. Document the relationship between the Filament resource pages and the underlying Cv model, including mass assignment protection and attribute casting. Include practical examples of creating a CV with core sections and demonstrate how data is persisted through Eloquent. Address common issues such as form validation errors and draft saving, and provide troubleshooting guidance. Highlight integration with Livewire components like CvReviewSidebar for real-time AI feedback during editing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Review Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI-powered CV review process. Explain the end-to-end workflow starting from the user initiating a review via the EditJobApplication interface, triggering the ProcessCvReview job. Detail how the job orchestrates the review lifecycle: setting review timestamps, handling notifications, and calling CvReviewService::analyzeForJob(). Document the interaction with OpenAI API through proper error handling with OpenAiApiException and retry mechanisms. Include the data flow from CV and job description input, through OpenAI analysis, to structured output storage in the JobApplication model. Provide code examples showing the job dispatch pattern, exception handling strategies, and asynchronous processing benefits. Address rate limiting considerations, API cost tracking via ai_review_cost_cents, and failure recovery procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: On-Demand Export
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on on-demand PDF export functionality. Explain how CvPdfController handles user-initiated PDF downloads by loading the CV with all relationships and rendering it through the show.blade.php template. Detail the filename generation logic that incorporates CV title, optional profile name, and date. Describe the integration with Spatie Laravel-PDF for A4 format rendering and download initiation. Include code examples from CvPdfController::download() and demonstrate how route definitions in web.php map to this functionality. Address common issues like missing CV data or template rendering failures, and provide performance tips for handling large CVs.

wiki_catalogs.name: CV Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on CV management in the cv-builder application. Explain the structure of a CV including its sections (header, summary, skills, experience, projects, education, references) and how they are managed through Filament relation managers. Detail the process of creating and editing CVs using the admin interface, including adding and ordering content. Describe the use of JSON fields for storing dynamic content like skills and highlights. Include practical examples from the codebase such as the CvResource and relation managers. Document the relationship between Cv and CVVersion models for versioning. Address common issues such as maintaining data integrity during edits and best practices for organizing CV content. Provide guidance on extending CV structure with new section types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the cover letter template system. Explain the purpose of the template field in the CoverLetter model and how it stores the source template with mustache-style {{variables}}. Document the database schema including the template (nullable text) and body (not null text) fields, and their relationship. Describe how templates are created and managed through the Filament CoverLettersRelationManager form with a textarea field that supports variable placeholders. Include examples of template syntax from the user guide showing {{company_name}}, {{role_title}}, and custom variables. Explain the business rule that templates can be null, allowing users to write letters from scratch. Address common issues like variable syntax errors and provide troubleshooting guidance. Reference the migration that created the cover_letters table and the data model specification.

wiki_catalogs.name: Key Performance Indicators
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on the five key performance indicators calculated by the MetricsCalculationService. Explain the purpose, calculation logic, and business significance of each KPI: applications per week, response rate, interview conversion rate, offer rate, and median days to first response. Detail how each metric is computed, including the specific database queries and mathematical formulas used. Document the handling of edge cases such as zero applications or division by zero scenarios. Explain why withdrawn applications are excluded from calculations and how time periods are parsed and applied. Provide real-world examples of how users can interpret these metrics to improve their job search strategy. Include information on data retention and the frequency of metric updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Creating Profiles
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for creating Section Focus Profiles. Explain the process of creating a new profile through the Filament admin interface, including form fields like name, included_section_ids, and section_order. Detail validation rules such as unique profile names per CV and valid section ID references. Include examples from the API contract showing POST requests and expected responses. Document the relationship between SectionFocusProfile and CV models, and explain how the relation manager integrates into the CV edit page. Address common issues like missing sections or invalid ordering, and provide troubleshooting guidance. Reference the database schema and constraints that enforce data integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Linking Skills to Experiences
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on linking skills to experiences, projects, or education entries. Explain the polymorphic relationship between SkillEvidence and evidenceable models (CvExperience, CvProject, CvEducation). Document the implementation of the morphTo and morphMany relationships in the models. Detail the Filament relation manager interface for creating and managing links, including dynamic field behavior and validation rules. Provide step-by-step examples of linking a skill like 'React' to a work experience with supporting notes. Include API endpoint documentation for POST /api/cvs/{cv_id}/skill-evidence with request/response examples and error cases. Address common issues such as duplicate prevention and referential integrity. Highlight the case-insensitive handling of skill names and its implications for querying and display.

wiki_catalogs.name: Service Layer Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the service layer in the cv-builder application. Describe the purpose and design of each service class including CoverLetterService, CvReviewService, KeywordCoverageService, KeywordScoringService, MetricsCalculationService, and PdfSnapshotService. Explain how business logic is encapsulated within these services to maintain separation of concerns from controllers and models. Document method signatures, input parameters, return types, and key algorithms used in each service. Illustrate service interactions with models, external APIs (OpenAI), and other services. Provide code examples showing service invocation patterns from controllers or Filament components. Address error handling, transaction management, and performance optimization strategies within the service layer. Explain dependency injection usage and service container registration where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Adding Custom Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for adding custom features to the cv-builder application. Explain how to create new Filament resources for additional entities, including setting up Pages, Tables, Forms, and RelationManagers. Demonstrate extending the data model with new Eloquent models and corresponding migrations while ensuring compatibility with existing code. Cover integration of new services following the service pattern used in CvReviewService and MetricsCalculationService. Provide examples of registering custom routes and controllers that integrate with the existing authentication and authorization system. Include guidance on how to add new dashboard widgets by extending Filament widgets like MetricsOverview and ApplicationsNeedingAction. Reference the specs directory for upcoming roadmap items that developers can implement. Address common issues such as route conflicts, model binding errors, and service injection failures, with troubleshooting tips and best practices for testing new features using PestPHP.

wiki_catalogs.name: CV Data Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the CV entity and its related components. Detail the Cv model fields including name, user_id, template, and soft delete timestamps. Explain the one-to-many relationships between Cv and its sections (HeaderInfo, Summary, SkillCategories, Experiences, Projects, Education, References, CustomSections). Document field definitions, data types, constraints, and indexes for each table. Illustrate how section ordering is maintained via the 'order' column in pivot tables. Describe the polymorphic nature of CvSection and its concrete implementations. Include data validation rules such as required fields for CV completeness. Address data access patterns for rendering CVs in different templates and performance considerations for eager loading related sections. Provide examples of common queries for retrieving CVs with all sections optimized for PDF generation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack & Dependencies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack of the cv-builder application. Detail the primary technologies: Laravel 12 as the backend framework, Filament 4 for the admin panel, Tailwind CSS for styling, Vite for asset bundling, and PestPHP for testing. Document external dependencies including openai-php/client for AI integration and spatie/laravel-pdf for PDF generation. Explain the role of each dependency in the system and their version compatibility. Include configuration patterns from config/app.php and service providers. Describe the frontend build process via Vite and JavaScript module organization. Cover testing dependencies and how they enable feature and unit testing. Provide insights into how these technologies work together to support the application's features and scalability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Events
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on the application events timeline system. Explain how ApplicationEvent records create a chronological history of interactions with employers, including interviews scheduled, responses received, and follow-up actions. Detail the relationship between JobApplication and ApplicationEvent models, with the EventsRelationManager providing the interface in the Filament admin panel. Describe the event types tracked in the system and their significance in the job search process. Document the database schema including timestamps, event categories, and descriptive fields. Explain how users can add, edit, and review events through the relation manager interface. Include examples of how event logging improves job search strategy by providing visibility into response times and interview frequency. Address how the events system supports reflection and optimization of job application techniques over time.

wiki_catalogs.name: Section Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for section management in CVs. Explain how each section type (Experience, Education, Skills, Projects, References, Summary, and Custom Sections) is implemented using Filament's RelationManagers and how they connect to their respective models. Describe the database schema for each section table and their relationship to the parent CV. Detail the UI patterns used for managing multiple sections, including inline creation, sorting, and deletion. Provide examples of how users can add, reorder, and customize sections through the admin interface. Document the implementation of dynamic section handling via polymorphic or foreign key relationships, and explain how section visibility and ordering are preserved. Address common issues such as handling empty sections, validation constraints, and performance when managing large numbers of entries. Include best practices for maintaining data consistency across related models.

wiki_catalogs.name: Match Score Interpretation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the match score calculation and interpretation. Explain how the CvReviewService calculates the overall match score (0-100) by combining skills (40%), experience (30%), keywords (20%), and evidence (10%) alignment. Document the extractJobRequirements method's role in parsing job descriptions into structured skills, competencies, and keywords. Describe how the score is presented in the UI via ai-review-results.blade.php and how users should interpret different score ranges (e.g., 0-30: Significant gaps, 31-60: Moderate alignment, 61-80: Good fit, 81-100: Excellent match). Include examples of how specific CV improvements can increase the score. Address edge cases like incomplete CVs triggering IncompleteCvException and missing job descriptions causing MissingJobDescriptionException. Provide guidance on score reliability and limitations of automated assessment.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Snapshots
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on automated PDF snapshot creation. Explain how PdfSnapshotService generates immutable PDFs when job applications are marked as sent, including the complete workflow: CV validation, relationship loading, PDF generation from cv.pdf blade template, SHA-256 hash calculation, 10MB size validation, and storage path definition. Detail the PDFSnapshot model's fields (job_application_id, cv_id, file_path, hash) and its one-to-one relationship with JobApplication. Describe the database schema from the migration file and how the observer pattern triggers snapshot creation. Include error handling for missing CVs and storage failures, and provide examples of hash verification for integrity checking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Job Application Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for job application tracking in the cv-builder application. Explain the JobApplication model and its key fields including status, job_title, source, application_deadline, next_action_date, and job_description. Describe the application lifecycle from draft to offer/rejected states. Detail how the system tracks application events through the ApplicationEvent model and displays them in a timeline. Explain the 'Needs Attention' filtering logic that identifies applications requiring action based on deadlines and status. Include examples from the Filament resource and widget implementations. Document how job applications link to CVs and PDF snapshots. Address common workflows such as creating applications, updating statuses, and recording events. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like missed deadlines or incorrect status transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Variable Interpolation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the variable interpolation system. Thoroughly explain the CoverLetterService::interpolate() method implementation that uses regex pattern '/\{\{(\w+)\}\}/' to match and replace variables. Document the input parameters: template string and variables array containing both JobApplication data (company_name, role_title) and user-provided values (value_prop, recent_win). Provide concrete code examples showing the interpolation process and output. Explain the design decision to keep missing placeholders visible for debugging rather than throwing errors. List all supported variables and their sources. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues like case sensitivity mismatches and syntax errors (single vs double braces). Reference the research document that justified the mustache-style approach over Blade templates or custom DSL. Provide performance considerations noting the <200ms processing time.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Widgets
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the dashboard widget components that visualize application metrics. Describe the implementation of MetricsOverview and ApplicationStatsOverview widgets, including their integration with Filament's StatsOverviewWidget. Explain how these widgets retrieve pre-calculated metric values from the database and format them for display. Document the use of Stat objects for defining value formatting, icons, colors, and descriptions. Detail the responsive design considerations and accessibility features. Provide examples of how the widgets handle data freshness with last_refreshed_at timestamps and diffForHumans() formatting. Explain the widget configuration options such as sort order and layout. Include guidance on customizing the widgets for different use cases and extending them with additional metrics.

wiki_catalogs.name: Applying Profiles
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for applying Section Focus Profiles. Explain how profiles are used during PDF generation and preview operations to filter and reorder CV sections without modifying the original data. Describe the GET /api/cvs/{cv_id}/sections?profile_id={id} endpoint behavior, including filtering by included_section_ids and sorting by section_order. Provide code examples showing how the Cv model's getSectionsWithProfile method works. Document integration points with the PDF export workflow and cover letter generation. Include performance considerations for render-time profile application. Address common issues such as profiles not displaying expected sections and provide debugging steps using model relationships. Reference real-world use cases from the user guide showing frontend vs backend focus scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Evidence Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on tracking and managing skill evidence across a CV. Describe how the system aggregates evidence through the GET /api/cvs/{cv_id}/skills-summary endpoint, grouping by skill_name (case-insensitive) and counting evidence links. Explain the response structure showing evidence_count and evidence_types. Document the database query logic and indexing strategy that enables efficient aggregation. Illustrate use cases such as identifying skills with insufficient evidence or comparing evidence strength across different skills. Show how this data integrates with metrics and AI review systems to inform tailoring decisions. Include testing considerations from SkillEvidenceTest.php, particularly around case insensitivity and cascade deletion. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like missing evidence counts or incorrect type mappings.

wiki_catalogs.name: Observer Pattern Usage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the observer pattern implementation in the cv-builder application. Detail how Laravel model observers are used to handle side effects for ApplicationEvent, JobApplication, and PdfTemplate models. Explain the specific events being observed (created, updated, deleted) and the resulting actions such as triggering PDF snapshot generation or updating application status. Document the registration process of observers in the service provider and their lifecycle management. Provide examples of observer logic from ApplicationEventObserver, JobApplicationObserver, and PdfTemplateObserver. Discuss the benefits of using observers for keeping models clean and separating concerns. Address potential pitfalls like observer cascades and performance implications of synchronous observation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Modifying Existing Functionality
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for modifying existing functionality in the cv-builder application. Explain how to customize the AI-powered CV review process by extending or modifying the CvReviewService and the ValidCvReviewSchema validation rule. Cover adapting the PDF generation workflow by extending PdfSnapshotService to support alternative rendering engines or storage drivers. Describe how to enhance the cover letter generation logic in CoverLetterService with custom template variables or formatting rules. Illustrate how to modify application behavior using Laravel observers such as JobApplicationObserver to trigger custom side effects on model events. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing service method overrides, dependency injection patterns, and event listener registration. Address backward compatibility concerns, versioning strategies, and testing implications when altering core services. Include performance considerations when introducing synchronous operations in observer methods or heavy processing in service classes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Job Application Data Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the JobApplication model and its lifecycle tracking. Document fields including job_title, company_name, status, applied_at, and AI review metadata (match_score, review_status). Explain foreign key relationships to Cv, User, and PDFSnapshot. Detail status transition constraints and business rules enforced at the model level. Describe the purpose of the 'needs_attention' computed attribute and its calculation logic. Include data validation rules ensuring required fields before submission. Document the soft delete capability via withdrawn_at timestamp. Explain indexing strategies on status and applied_at for efficient filtering in dashboard queries. Provide examples of queries for retrieving applications needing attention or recently reviewed by AI.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up the cv-builder application locally. Provide step-by-step installation instructions including cloning the repository, installing PHP and Node.js dependencies via Composer and NPM, configuring environment variables in .env, and running database migrations. Include setup of OpenAI API credentials and any required service configurations. Document the initial seeding process using DatabaseSeeder and PdfTemplateSeeder. Guide users through launching the development server with Artisan and Vite. Highlight common setup issues and their solutions, such as database connection errors or missing extensions. Include verification steps to confirm successful installation, such as accessing the /admin panel and creating a test CV. Make the guide beginner-friendly while providing technical depth for troubleshooting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Needs Attention Filtering
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on the intelligent prioritization system. Explain the scopeNeedsAttention() query scope in the JobApplication model that identifies applications requiring user action. Detail the three primary conditions that trigger the 'needs attention' status: next_action_date being today or in the past, send_status being 'draft', or having no next_action_date while in 'pending' or 'interviewing' status. Describe how the ApplicationsNeedingAction widget displays these applications in the dashboard with visual prioritization. Explain the integration with the JobApplicationsTable.php that allows filtering by 'needs attention' status. Include the SQL logic behind the filter and how it excludes applications with 'rejected' or 'withdrawn' statuses. Provide examples of how this system helps users manage their job search efficiently by surfacing time-sensitive actions. Address configuration options and potential customizations for the filtering criteria.

wiki_catalogs.name: CV Versioning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for CV versioning functionality. Explain how historical versions of CVs are captured and stored using the CVVersion model and its associated migration. Describe the trigger mechanism (likely via Eloquent events or observers) that creates a new version upon save or update. Detail the structure of the CVVersions resource in Filament, including list, create, edit, and view pages, and how users can browse and restore previous versions. Document the relationship between CV and CVVersion, including data serialization strategy (e.g., JSON storage of full CV state). Explain integration with PdfSnapshotService to ensure versioned PDFs are generated and linked correctly. Provide examples of version rollback scenarios and discuss data integrity considerations. Address performance implications of storing multiple versions and suggest retention policies or cleanup strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Actionable Recommendations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the actionable recommendations generated by the AI review system. Explain the six types of recommendations: Strategic Gaps Analysis, Section Reordering, Highlight Prioritization, Language Alignment, and Skill Evidence Assessment. Document how these recommendations are structured in the ai_review_data JSON field and rendered in the EditJobApplication page using the ai-review-results.blade.php template. Provide concrete examples of each recommendation type and how users can implement them. Detail the UI components like action checklists, bullet point improvements, and skill gap visualizations. Explain how the CvReviewService generates these suggestions through targeted OpenAI prompts and how they're designed to be specific and implementable. Include best practices for acting on recommendations and tracking improvement over time through subsequent reviews.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template Selection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on PDF template selection and usage. Explain how PdfTemplate model stores template configurations and how users can select templates via the Filament admin interface. Describe the template hierarchy with default templates (classic, modern, default) and how they're rendered through blade templates in resources/views/cv/templates/. Detail how PdfSnapshotService uses the selected template during PDF generation, falling back to default when no template is chosen. Include examples of template variable interpolation and customization options. Address common issues like missing template files or incorrect view paths, and provide guidance on creating custom templates.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI-Powered CV Review
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the AI-powered CV review system. Explain how the CvReviewService analyzes a CV against a job description using OpenAI API to generate actionable recommendations. Detail the review process including extracting job requirements, analyzing skill gaps, suggesting section reordering, and improving bullet points. Describe the implementation of the ProcessCvReview job for asynchronous processing. Explain how review results are displayed in the Filament interface with tabs for different analysis areas (skill gaps, section priority, bullet improvements, language suggestions). Document the data structure of review results and how stale reviews are detected when the CV changes. Include configuration requirements for OpenAI API keys and rate limiting considerations. Provide examples of typical review outputs and how users should interpret match scores and recommendations. Address error handling for API failures and validation requirements (job description must be present).

wiki_catalogs.name: Versioning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the cover letter versioning system. Explain how the version field (integer, default 1) enables A/B testing of different letter variations. Document how version numbers auto-increment per job application, with examples showing Version 1 (formal tone) and Version 2 (enthusiastic tone). Describe the UI implementation in the Filament relation manager table showing version as a sortable column. Explain the business rules: only one cover letter per application can be marked as sent, and sent letters become immutable (edit/delete actions disabled). Detail the state transition from draft (is_sent=false) to sent (is_sent=true, sent_at timestamp set) and why it's irreversible. Include user guidance on creating multiple versions for tone testing and reusing templates across applications. Reference the contract tests that verify version auto-increment behavior and the inability to modify sent letters.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics Calculation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the metrics calculation process and its integration points. Explain the architecture and implementation of the MetricsCalculationService, including its refreshAllMetrics() method and individual calculation methods for each KPI. Detail the data flow from database queries to persisted metric values, including the use of updateOrCreate() for idempotent operations. Document the scheduled execution via Laravel's task scheduler that runs daily at 2:00 AM. Explain how application events and status changes trigger metric recalculation through observers. Cover the API endpoints for manual metric refresh and period-based filtering as defined in the metrics dashboard contract. Include performance considerations such as query optimization and indexing strategies. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like stale metrics or calculation failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Non-Destructive Tailoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content explaining the non-destructive nature of Section Focus Profiles. Emphasize how this design preserves the original CV structure while enabling tailored views for different job applications. Contrast this approach with destructive editing methods and explain the business benefits, such as maintaining a single source of truth and enabling instant switching between profiles. Document the data flow when a profile is deleted and confirm that CV sections remain intact. Include examples showing how multiple profiles (e.g., Frontend Focus, Backend Focus) can coexist for the same CV. Reference the database design that supports this pattern through JSON arrays for included_section_ids and section_order. Address user concerns about data loss and provide best practices for profile management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Alignment Analysis
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on using skill evidence data for job application alignment analysis. Explain how the CvReviewService and KeywordScoringService leverage evidence links to strengthen AI-generated recommendations. Describe how verified skills with multiple evidence sources are prioritized in match scoring and section recommendations. Document the integration points where evidence data enhances AI review outputs, such as in the ai-review-results.blade.php template. Provide examples of how strong evidence for a skill like 'React' leads to more confident recommendations when applying for frontend roles. Discuss future integration possibilities with cover letter generation (e.g., {{skill_evidence:React}} variable). Include best practices for users to maximize alignment by strategically linking skills to impactful experiences. Reference user guide examples showing evidence-based decision making in application tailoring.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the event system in the cv-builder application. Describe how ApplicationEvent model serves as a timeline for job application lifecycle tracking. Explain the relationship between JobApplication and ApplicationEvent, including how events are created and managed through the EventsRelationManager in Filament. Document the event types supported (e.g., submission, interview, rejection) and their significance in the application workflow. Illustrate how the event system enables audit trails and status tracking. Provide examples of event creation patterns and how they integrate with the observer system. Discuss query patterns for retrieving event timelines and their use in reporting and metrics calculation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Extension Best Practices
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content on best practices for extending the cv-builder application. Emphasize proper code organization by placing new services in app/Services/, custom rules in app/Rules/, and observers in app/Observers/. Explain the importance of dependency injection and service container binding when replacing or augmenting core functionality. Cover configuration management through Laravel's config system, particularly for third-party integrations like OpenAI or alternative AI providers. Discuss strategies for maintaining backward compatibility when introducing breaking changes, including deprecation notices and migration paths. Provide guidelines for testing extensions using both feature and unit tests, leveraging existing test structure in the tests/ directory. Recommend approaches for documenting custom features and contributing to the project roadmap in specs/. Address security considerations such as input validation, output escaping, and rate limiting when exposing new endpoints or extending existing ones. Include performance optimization tips like caching expensive operations and deferring processing to queued jobs.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Snapshot Data Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for PDFSnapshot entity. Detail fields including hash, path, generated_by, and foreign key to JobApplication. Explain the immutability principle and how hash verification ensures document integrity. Document the relationship between PDFSnapshot and JobApplication (one-to-one) and the cascade delete behavior. Describe storage path conventions and file naming strategy. Include data validation rules ensuring hash uniqueness and path validity. Address performance considerations for serving large numbers of PDFs and security aspects of file access control. Provide examples of queries for retrieving snapshots by hash or associated application, and demonstrate integrity verification workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Concepts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the fundamental concepts of the cv-builder application. Explain key entities such as CV, JobApplication, PDFSnapshot, and SectionFocusProfile, detailing their purpose and relationships. Describe the concept of CV versioning through CVVersion model and non-destructive tailoring via SectionFocusProfiles. Introduce the AI-powered review process managed by CvReviewService and its interaction with OpenAI. Cover the metrics calculation system and performance tracking. Illustrate how cover letters are generated using templates and variable interpolation. Use real examples from the codebase to demonstrate how these concepts work together in practice. Provide clear definitions and contextual usage to help beginners grasp the domain model while offering technical depth for developers extending the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: CV Cloning
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for CV cloning functionality. Explain how users can duplicate an existing CV to create a new one with identical content, including all sections, skills, and metadata. Describe the implementation within CreateCv.php and how it handles pre-filling form data from a source CV. Detail the deep copy logic in the Cv model or service layer that replicates related records (sections, experiences, education, etc.) while establishing new ownership and timestamps. Document how cloned CVs handle associated PDF snapshots and version history - whether they are inherited or regenerated. Include practical examples of using cloning for tailoring CVs to different job types. Reference the CvCloningTest.php to illustrate expected behavior and edge cases such as cloning soft-deleted CVs or handling large CVs with many sections. Address potential performance bottlenecks and memory usage during cloning operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for PDF generation in the cv-builder application. Explain the two PDF generation workflows: on-demand export and PDF snapshots. Describe how the PdfSnapshotService generates PDFs using Spatie Laravel-PDF with hash verification for integrity. Detail the PDFSnapshot model that stores file paths, hashes, and metadata. Explain how PDF snapshots are automatically created when job applications are sent, preserving the exact CV state at submission. Document the Blade template system for PDF rendering, including the different CV templates (classic, default, modern). Include configuration options for PDF generation such as margins, orientation, and font settings. Provide examples of controller implementation and template customization. Address file storage strategies, cleanup policies, and security considerations for generated PDFs. Troubleshoot common issues like styling problems in PDF output or missing files.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: CV Builder Application

## 1. Project Introduction

The CV Builder application is a sophisticated Laravel-based platform designed to help users create, manage, and optimize their curriculum vitae for job applications. The system provides comprehensive CV management with AI-powered review capabilities, PDF generation, and job application tracking.

**Core Goals and Objectives:**
- Enable users to create and manage multiple CVs with customizable sections
- Provide AI-driven CV analysis against job descriptions to improve match scores
- Generate professional PDF versions of CVs with template selection
- Track job applications and associated metrics
- Offer version control and snapshot capabilities for CVs

**Target Audience:**
- Job seekers looking to optimize their CVs for specific positions
- Career professionals managing multiple job applications
- Users who want data-driven insights into their job search performance
- Individuals seeking to improve their CV content with AI-powered suggestions

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a layered architecture with clear separation of concerns, leveraging Laravel's MVC pattern enhanced with service-oriented design. The system is built around several core domains:

- **CV Management**: Handles CV creation, editing, and versioning
- **Job Application Tracking**: Manages the job application lifecycle
- **AI-Powered Review**: Analyzes CVs against job descriptions using OpenAI
- **Document Generation**: Creates PDF versions of CVs
- **Analytics**: Tracks application metrics and performance

### Design Patterns

The application employs several key design patterns:

- **Service Pattern**: Business logic is encapsulated in service classes (e.g., `CvReviewService`, `PdfSnapshotService`)
- **Repository Pattern**: Eloquent models act as repositories for data access
- **Observer Pattern**: Model observers handle side effects (e.g., `JobApplicationObserver`)
- **Factory Pattern**: Factories for test data generation
- **Strategy Pattern**: Different PDF templates represent rendering strategies

### System Relationships and Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[Web Interface]
    B --> C[HTTP Controllers]
    C --> D[Service Layer]
    D --> E[Eloquent Models]
    E --> F[(Database)]
    D --> G[External APIs]
    G --> H[OpenAI API]
    D --> I[File Storage]
    J[Scheduler] --> K[Cron Jobs]
    K --> D
```

### Component Relationships

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Cv] --> B[CVVersion]
    A --> C[PDFSnapshot]
    A --> D[JobApplication]
    A --> E[SectionFocusProfile]
    A --> F[CvSection]
    F --> G[CvSummary]
    F --> H[CvSkillCategory]
    F --> I[CvExperience]
    F --> J[CvProject]
    F --> K[CvEducation]
    F --> L[CvReference]
    F --> M[CvCustomSection]
    D --> N[ApplicationEvent]
    D --> O[CoverLetter]
    D --> P[PDFSnapshot]
    Q[CvReviewService] --> H
    Q --> R[OpenAI API]
    S[PdfSnapshotService] --> T[Spatie PDF]
    U[MetricsCalculationService] --> V[Metrics]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Web Routes**: `routes/web.php` - Defines the application's HTTP endpoints
- **Console Commands**: `app/Console/Commands/CheckReviewBudget.php` - Scheduled tasks for system maintenance

### Core Modules
- **CV Management**: `app/Models/Cv.php` - Central model for CV operations
- **AI Review System**: `app/Services/CvReviewService.php` - Handles CV analysis against job descriptions
- **PDF Generation**: `app/Services/PdfSnapshotService.php` - Creates and manages PDF versions of CVs
- **Application Tracking**: `app/Models/JobApplication.php` - Manages job application lifecycle

### Configuration Approach
- **Environment Configuration**: `config/services.php` - External service credentials (OpenAI)
- **Framework Configuration**: `config/app.php`, `config/database.php` - Laravel core settings
- **Package Configuration**: `config/filament.php` - Filament admin panel settings

### External Dependencies
- **Laravel Framework**: `composer.json` - Core PHP framework
- **Filament Admin**: `composer.json` - Admin panel and UI components
- **OpenAI Client**: `composer.json` - Integration with OpenAI API
- **Spatie PDF**: `composer.json` - PDF generation library

### Integration Points
- **OpenAI API**: `app/Services/CvReviewService.php` - AI-powered CV analysis
- **File Storage**: `app/Services/PdfSnapshotService.php` - PDF file management
- **Database**: Eloquent models across the application - Data persistence

## 4. Key Features

### CV Management and Versioning
The application provides comprehensive CV management with version control capabilities. When a CV is modified, the system automatically creates version snapshots to track changes over time.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Draft
    Draft --> Published: Save
    Published --> Edited: Modify
    Edited --> Versioned: Save Changes
    Versioned --> Archived: Mark as Inactive
    Archived --> [*]: Delete
```

The CV versioning system is implemented through the `CVVersion` model and the `cloneCv` method in the `Cv` model, which creates a complete snapshot of the CV state before making changes.

Sources:
- [Cv.php](app/Models/Cv.php#L300-L354)
- [CVVersion.php](app/Models/CVVersion.php)

### AI-Powered CV Review
The application integrates with OpenAI to provide intelligent CV analysis against job descriptions. This feature evaluates the match between a user's CV and a specific job posting, providing actionable feedback to improve the application's success chances.

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    User->>+Application: Submit CV for Review
    Application->>+CvReviewService: analyzeForJob()
    CvReviewService->>+OpenAI API: Send CV and Job Description
    OpenAI API-->>-CvReviewService: Return Analysis Results
    CvReviewService->>Application: Process and Validate Results
    Application->>User: Display Review with Recommendations
```

The review service calculates a match score and provides specific recommendations for improvement, including skill gaps, section improvements, and language suggestions.

Sources:
- [CvReviewService.php](app/Services/CvReviewService.php)
- [JobApplication.php](app/Models/JobApplication.php)

### PDF Generation and Snapshots
The system provides robust PDF generation capabilities, allowing users to export their CVs in professional formats. The PDF snapshot feature creates immutable copies of CVs at specific points in time, which is particularly useful for job applications.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[CV Data] --> B[PdfSnapshotService]
    B --> C{Template Selected?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Use Selected Template]
    C -->|No| E[Use Default Template]
    D --> F[Generate PDF]
    E --> F
    F --> G[Store in Filesystem]
    G --> H[Create PDFSnapshot Record]
    H --> I[Return Downloadable Link]
```

The PDF generation is handled by the Spatie PDF package, with templates defined in the `resources/views/cv/templates/` directory.

Sources:
- [PdfSnapshotService.php](app/Services/PdfSnapshotService.php)
- [CvPdfController.php](app/Http/Controllers/CvPdfController.php)

### Job Application Tracking and Analytics
The application includes comprehensive job application tracking with metrics calculation. Users can monitor their application status, track responses, and view performance metrics over time.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> ApplicationSubmitted
    ApplicationSubmitted --> AwaitingResponse
    AwaitingResponse --> InterviewScheduled: Response Received
    InterviewScheduled --> OfferReceived: Successful Interview
    InterviewScheduled --> Rejected: Unsuccessful
    OfferReceived --> Accepted: Job Offer
    OfferReceived --> Rejected: Declined Offer
    AwaitingResponse --> Rejected: No Response
```

The metrics system calculates key performance indicators such as response rate, interview conversion rate, and median days to first response, providing valuable insights into the job search process.

Sources:
- [MetricsCalculationService.php](app/Services/MetricsCalculationService.php)
- [JobApplication.php](app/Models/JobApplication.php)
</blog>
